thread.title: Dramatic video shows girl pulled alive from rubble in Syria - CNN.com
thread.title_full: Dramatic video shows girl pulled alive from rubble in Syria - CNN.com

author: Euan Mckirdy
title: Dramatic video shows girl pulled alive from rubble in Syria - CNN.com
text: Moment rescuers spot girl buried under rubble 01:06 (CNN) The dramatic rescue of a young girl trapped in the rubble of a bombed-out Syrian house has been caught on video and posted online. The frantic work of a team of white-helmeted Syrian civil defense teams shows the heart-wrenching extrication of the crying child, a five-year-old named Aya, from a ruined house in the Tishreen area of Damascus. In the clip, a team is seen walking through the Damascus neighborhood as dust settles from a recent explosion. The White Helmets: 'The most dangerous job in the world' A woman starts yelling in Arabic, directing the team of rescuers to a door and up a flight of stairs. When they reach the wrecked room where Aya is trapped one man calls out to another, instructing him to begin clearing the rubble with their bare hands. "With your hands, with your hands! Come on come on!" he urges. Read More A few team members are filmed as they carefully, but urgently, remove pieces of fallen masonry. One of the rescuers seeks to reassure Aya, telling her: "We are here now dear, we are here. Don't be scared, we are here." The woman documenting the 'Humans of Damascus' Around a minute into the recording, she is heard crying. Slowly her dusty form emerges from the debris as the team works to remove the rubble covering her. When she is finally freed from the ruins, a stream of blood is seen running down her dust-caked face. JUST WATCHED
